name: Calcarea  sulphurica

Eyes: INFLAMMATION OF THE EYES, WITH DISCHARGE OF THICK, YELLOW MATTER
Fever: Hectic fever, caused by formation of pus
With cough and burning in soles
Head: Scald-head of children, if there be purulent discharge, or yellow, purulent crusts
Stool: Diarrhoea after maple sugar and from change of weather
Pus-like, slimy discharge from the bowels
PAINFUL ABSCESSES ABOUT THE ANUS in cases of fistula
Abdomen: Pain in region of liver, in right side of pelvis, followed by weakness, nausea, and pain in stomach
Face: PIMPLES AND PUSTULES ON THE FACE
Respiratory: Cough, with purulent and sanious sputa and hectic fever
Empyema, pus forming in the lungs or pleural cavities
Catarrh, with thick, lumpy, white-yellow or pus-like secretions
Mouth: Tongue flabby, resembling a layer of dried clay
Nose: Cold in the head, with thick, YELLOWISH, PURULENT SECRETION, frequently tinged with blood
Female: Menses late, long-lasting, with headache, twitching great weakness
Skin: , unhealthy, discharging pus; they do not heal readily
Purulent exudation in or upon the skin
Many little matter less pimples under the hair, bleeding when scratched
Throat: Last stage of ulcerated sore throat, with discharge of yellow matter
Suppurating stage of tonsillitis, when abscess is discharging
Ears: Deafness, with discharge of matter from the middle ear, sometimes mixed with blood

details: Eczema and torpid glandular swellings. Cystic tumors. Fibroids. Suppurative processes come within the range of this remedy, after pus has found a vent. MUCOUS DISCHARGES ARE YELLOW, THICK AND LUMPY. Lupus vulgaris.
Natural History: Sulphate of Lime - Plaster of Paris
dosage: Second and third trituration. The twelfth potency has been found effective in Lupus.
